<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_allocatedstorage_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_allocatedstorage_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allocated<wbr>Storage</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Number</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The amount of storage in gibibytes (GiB) to allocate to each DB instance in the Multi-AZ DB cluster.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_allowmajorversionupgrade_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_allowmajorversionupgrade_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allow<wbr>Major<wbr>Version<wbr>Upgrade</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Enable to allow major engine version upgrades when changing engine versions. Defaults to <code>false</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_applyimmediately_yaml">

    </dt>

See the <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/aurora-global-database-getting-started.html#aurora-global-database.use-snapshot">AWS documentation</a> or the Global Cluster Restored From Snapshot example for instructions on building a global cluster starting with a snapshot.</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"

When restoring an unencrypted <code>snapshot_identifier</code>, the <code>kms_key_id</code> argument must be provided to encrypt the restored cluster. The provider will only perform drift detection if a configuration value is provided.</dd><dt class="property-optional"

        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>(Forces new for Multi-AZ DB clusters) Specifies the storage type to be associated with the DB cluster. For Aurora DB clusters, <code>storage_type</code> modifications can be done in-place. For Multi-AZ DB Clusters, the <code>iops</code> argument must also be set. Valid values are: <code>&quot;&quot;</code>, <code>aurora-iopt1</code> (Aurora DB Clusters); <code>io1</code>, <code>io2</code> (Multi-AZ DB Clusters). <h4 id="clusterscalingconfiguration">
Cluster<wbr>Scaling<wbr>Configuration<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="python,go" class="inline">, Cluster<wbr>Scaling<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Args</pulumi-choosable>
</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="autopause_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#autopause_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Auto<wbr>Pause</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Whether to enable automatic pause. A DB cluster can be paused only when it's idle (it has no connections). If a DB cluster is paused for more than seven days, the DB cluster might be backed up with a snapshot. In this case, the DB cluster is restored when there is a request to connect to it. Defaults to <code>true</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="maxcapacity_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#maxcapacity_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Max<wbr>Capacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Maximum capacity for an Aurora DB cluster in <code>serverless</code> DB engine mode. The maximum capacity must be greater than or equal to the minimum capacity. Valid Aurora MySQL capacity values are <code>1</code>, <code>2</code>, <code>4</code>, <code>8</code>, <code>16</code>, <code>32</code>, <code>64</code>, <code>128</code>, <code>256</code>. Valid Aurora PostgreSQL capacity values are (<code>2</code>, <code>4</code>, <code>8</code>, <code>16</code>, <code>32</code>, <code>64</code>, <code>192</code>, and <code>384</code>). Defaults to <code>16</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="mincapacity_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#mincapacity_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Min<wbr>Capacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Minimum capacity for an Aurora DB cluster in <code>serverless</code> DB engine mode. The minimum capacity must be lesser than or equal to the maximum capacity. Valid Aurora MySQL capacity values are <code>1</code>, <code>2</code>, <code>4</code>, <code>8</code>, <code>16</code>, <code>32</code>, <code>64</code>, <code>128</code>, <code>256</code>. Valid Aurora PostgreSQL capacity values are (<code>2</code>, <code>4</code>, <code>8</code>, <code>16</code>, <code>32</code>, <code>64</code>, <code>192</code>, and <code>384</code>). Defaults to <code>1</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="secondsbeforetimeout_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#secondsbeforetimeout_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Seconds<wbr>Before<wbr>Timeout</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Amount of time, in seconds, that Aurora Serverless v1 tries to find a scaling point to perform seamless scaling before enforcing the timeout action. Valid values are <code>60</code> through <code>600</code>. Defaults to <code>300</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="secondsuntilautopause_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#secondsuntilautopause_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Seconds<wbr>Until<wbr>Auto<wbr>Pause</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Time, in seconds, before an Aurora DB cluster in serverless mode is paused. Valid values are <code>300</code> through <code>86400</code>. Defaults to <code>300</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="timeoutaction_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#timeoutaction_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Timeout<wbr>Action</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Action to take when the timeout is reached. Valid values: <code>ForceApplyCapacityChange</code>, <code>RollbackCapacityChange</code>. Defaults to <code>RollbackCapacityChange</code>. See <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/aurora-serverless-v1.how-it-works.html#aurora-serverless.how-it-works.timeout-action">documentation</a>.</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

        <span id="secondsbeforetimeout_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#secondsbeforetimeout_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">seconds<wbr>Before<wbr>Timeout</a>

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Integer</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Amount of time, in seconds, that Aurora Serverless v1 tries to find a scaling point to perform seamless scaling before enforcing the timeout action. Valid values are <code>60</code> through <code>600</code>. Defaults to <code>300</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"

<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#min_capacity_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">min_<wbr>capacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">float</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Minimum capacity for an Aurora DB cluster in <code>provisioned</code> DB engine mode. The minimum capacity must be lesser than or equal to the maximum capacity. Valid capacity values are in a range of <code>0</code> up to <code>256</code> in steps of <code>0.5</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="seconds_until_auto_pause_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#seconds_until_auto_pause_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">seconds_<wbr>until_<wbr>auto_<wbr>pause</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Time, in seconds, before an Aurora DB cluster in <code>provisioned</code> DB engine mode is paused. Valid values are <code>300</code> through <code>86400</code>.</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="yaml">

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import RDS Clusters using the `cluster_identifier`. For example:

```sh
$ pulumi import aws:rds/cluster:Cluster aurora_cluster aurora-prod-cluster
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).
